page.title: 13BOUGHTON MONCHELSEA SCHOOL
page.content: This Primary School was built in 1850 at a cost of Â£609. It consisted of the teacher's residence, now used as office space, and "two rooms..with accommodation for 75 boys and 75 girls allowing six square feet per child "; these now form the school hall. The school, a County Junior and Infant School, currently has 171 children in six classes, with Headmaster and six teaching staff. Its buildings and facilities have increased, of course, since 1850, an indoor heated swimming pool being provided in 1963 by the active Parent-Teacher Association. Outside is a hard play area, football pitch, adventure playground, outdoor theatre, pond and woodland area. Children come from a wide area, and extra-curricular activities include various music groups, as well as games, Astronomy and French clubs.
